short_summary: Medical Fridge and Freezer Maintenance Service for the Quebec Region
description: Maintenance of medical refrigerators and freezers to meet Accreditation Canada standards and manufacturer's recommendations in order to ensure that the medications are stored at the right temperature and to extend the life of the refrigerators and freezers as a result of performing preventive maintenance on them. The contractor must submit a report for each visit, including the technician's name, company name, description of defect, price of replacement part, estimated repair time, and estimated total cost of repair. The contractor must also submit a certificate of calibration attesting that the equipment is compliant with Accreditation Canada standards.

**Title:** Medical Fridge and Freezer Maintenance Service for the Quebec Region

**Reference Number:** cb-665-94910543
**Amendment Number:** 11
**Solicitation Number:** 21301-23-4518571
**Publication Date:** 2023-12-08
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-02-13 (14:00:00)

The Correctional Service of Canada has issued an invitation for proposal for Medical Fridge and Freezer Maintenance Service for the Quebec Region.

**Objective:**
This procurement aims to provide a reliable and efficient maintenance service for medical refrigerators and freezers used in Correctional Service of Canada Health Centres throughout the Quebec Region.

**Scope of Work:**
The successful bidder will be responsible for performing preventive maintenance on medical refrigerators and freezers, ensuring they meet Accreditation Canada standards and the manufacturer's recommendations. This includes:

* Delivering maintenance reports detailing the work performed on each visit to the Head of Physical Health Services
* Providing cost estimates and submitting them for approval prior to proceeding with repairs
* Submitting a Certificate of Calibration to attest that the equipment is compliant with Accreditation Canada standards

**Tender Details:**
* The duration of the contract is from the date of contract award to January 31, 2025, with the option to renew for two additional one-year periods
* The estimated quantity of commodity is outlined in the solicitation document statement of work and basis of payment
* Trade Agreement: Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Procurement Strategy: Competitive, Open Bidding

**Bidder Information:**
Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process within 15 working days of receipt. Contact Francine Marcotte, Contracting Authority, at (343) 598-9309 or Francine.Marcotte@CSC-SCC.gc.ca.

**Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) Seminars:**
PAC offers free seminars for businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada. Topics include an overview of the federal government procurement process, searching for opportunities on the Buy and Sell website, and more.
